sentences.english: Which, briefly, is like an explosion in a spear factory.
sentences.chinese: 簡單地說，就像兵工廠發生了爆炸。

sentences.english: Then consider how Pakistan is rapidly expanding its arsenal of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 再想想巴基斯坦是如何快速擴張它的核武器兵工廠的。

sentences.english: They planned to take out the enemy arsenal by bombing it.
sentences.chinese: 他們計劃炸燬敵兵工廠。

sentences.english: It is the ultimate weapon of war in the Protoss arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 它是神族兵工廠所擁有的終極戰爭武器。

sentences.english: The enemy bombers targeted our arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 敵機把我們的兵工廠作爲轟炸目標。
艾弗瑞是軍隊的兵工廠。

sentences.english: The plant is the only nuclear weapons assembly and disassembly facility in the US.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是美國唯一一個組裝和拆解武器的兵工廠。

sentences.english: The rebels bombed the munition factory.
sentences.chinese: 反叛分子用炸彈炸燬兵工廠。

sentences.english: While Lin Wu Yang yourself, personally take people to the factory.
sentences.chinese: 而林午陽自己，則親自帶人前往兵工廠。

sentences.english: < /p> < p> Gu Yuming and stone into the Arsenal factory, two people surprised.
sentences.chinese: 顧玉明和石頭衝進兵工廠廠房，二人驚住了。

sentences.english: The roof of the armory collapsed during the storm.
sentences.chinese: 兵工廠的屋頂在風暴中已坍塌。

definition: to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to assault a fortified position/(fig.) to concentrate one's efforts on a particularly difficult part of one's mission
